intro: Gilia nyensis, commonly known as the New Mexico gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gilia nyensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar and habitat for various wildlife species.
